greed.question: Did I make acquiring wealth and material possessions a driving force in my life?
greed.description: This sin makes money an idol that replaces trust in God's providence, turning what should be a tool for good into an object of worship.

autonomy.question: Did I take for granted the good things in my life, thinking that they are solely due to my own efforts and determination, rather than acknowledging God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: to my own abilities rather than God 's providence
autonomy.question: Have I taken for granted my blessings in life, attributing them to my own abilities rather than God's providence?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

extracted_data_phrases: solely to your own efforts and abilities
autonomy.question: Did you attribute your personal accomplishments and successes solely to your own efforts and abilities, forgetting to acknowledge any role that God's providence may have played in them?
autonomy.description: Believing that one's blessings are due to one's own self-sufficiency and determination is a sin as it is a rejection of recognizing Divine Providence as being ultimately responsible.

envy.question: Have I felt envy towards others' accomplishments and secretly wished they would stumble in their endeavors?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

envy.question: Have I secretly wished for others' blessings to be taken away from them, so that I would feel better about my own life?
envy.description: Envy leads us to have discontent for another's possessions so we won't feel the pain of comparison or perceived lack in our own lives.

extracted_data_phrases: perhaps in online interactions or social media
incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control when speaking to others, perhaps in online interactions or social media, and use language that was vulgar or inappropriate?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and use words that were vulgar or hurtful to others?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

extracted_data_phrases: in a way that was unbecoming of my Christian values
incontinence.question: Did I lack self-control and speak to others in a way that was unbecoming of my Christian values, using language that was unfit for respectful conversation?
incontinence.description: This sin of incontinence shows a lack of self-restraint and violates the dignity of others.

gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking beyond what's reasonable, especially when it comes to food choices that could compromise my physical health and spiritual well-being?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

gluttony.question: Did I overindulge in eating or drinking to an extent that hindered my ability to observe a moderate and temperate life?
gluttony.description: This sin of gluttony demonstrates an inordinate attachment to worldly pleasures and rejects the call to temperance.

extracted_data_phrases: over my financial obligations or family needs
prodigality.question: Have I made excessive and wasteful use of money to take precedence over my financial obligations or family needs?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

prodigality.question: Have I used financial resources in excessive and wasteful ways, prioritizing personal interests over family needs?
prodigality.description: This sin violates the virtue of stewardship by recklessly risking resources God has entrusted to us, while potentially harming our ability to provide for family and those in need.

gossip.question: Have I taken pleasure in sharing others' private affairs through conversations, even if what I shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.

extracted_data_phrases: with pleasure about another 's private affairs
gossip.question: Have I spoken with pleasure about another's private affairs, even if what was shared was true?
gossip.description: Gossip violates human dignity and charity by harming others' reputations for our own entertainment or pride.
